result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy Lynn Segerson

Defendant Amy Lynn Segerson in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Amy Lynn Segerson.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Jury Trial.  Defense request an adjournment. For reasons presented to the Court. Court GRANTED defense motion. Case adjourned, branch 38.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Defense Motion to Adjourn Trial, filed and forwarded for review.

Defendant Amy Lynn Segerson not in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Amy Lynn Segerson. Attorney Tishberg appeared by video along with a member of the victim's family.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a final pre-trial. Defendant's appearance waived for reasons placed on the record. State filed a motion for joinder with 22CM1803. Defense objects. Court GRANTS State's motion.
State to file new witness list. Case in trial posture. Jury trial date remains calendared.
Motion In Limine Received and Filed.
Joinder Motion Received and Filed.

Case in court for a status conference. Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.
Case adjourned.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court takes no action on bail at this time. Case remains calendared in br 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amy Lynn Segerson in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mark Tishberg also appeared for the victim KH.
Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Bail motion by State argued. Additional statements made by Attorney Tishberg on behalf of the victim.
Court adjourns for continued bail/bond hearing due to Court calendar.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case in court for pre-trial conference. State requests a bail review hearing. Case adjourned back to Br 30.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (DATE). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kyle H. and Amanda B.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Amy Lynn Segerson in court.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/25/2022@2pm
